trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged"></xref> event.
This class cannot be inherited.
<xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs> provides data for a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event notifies the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService> and registered event handlers that a particular component in the currently active document has been changed.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs> provides the following information:
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.Component%2A> property that indicates the component that was modified.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.Member%2A> property that indicates the member that was changed.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.NewValue%2A> property that indicates the new value of the member.
An <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.OldValue%2A> property that indicates the old value of the member.
Component designers typically raise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event automatically when components are added, removed, or modified.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event is not raised during form load and unload because changes at this time are expected.

A component designer might raise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event after it changes a property of the component; this ensures that the Properties window will display the updated property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs"></xref> class.
The designer for a component calls this constructor after it has changed a property of the component.
This ensures that the Properties window will display the property's updated value.
The component that was changed.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor"></xref> that represents the member that was changed.
The old value of the changed member.
The new value of the changed member.
Gets the component that was modified.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the component that was modified.
Gets the member that has been changed.
This property can be `null` if the member is unknown.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor"></xref> that indicates the member that has been changed.
Gets the new value of the changed member.
This property has meaning only if the member is not `null`.
The new value of the changed member.
This property can be `null`.
Gets the old value of the changed member.
This property has meaning only if the member is not `null`.
The old value of the changed member.
This property can be `null`.
